definitions: To move a boat or canoe through water using a paddle.
To walk with bare feet in shallow water.
To hit someone or something with a paddle or similar flat object, especially as a form of punishment.
To propel oneself through water using hands and feet, like a dog.
examples: They paddle their canoe across the lake.
Children love to paddle in the sea.
The teacher used to paddle disobedient students.
The dog will paddle in the pool.
